DataElement.preferredName: Ipsilateral Lung Radiation Therapy 30 Percent Prescription Dose Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the percentage of the ipsilateral lung receiving 30% of the prescription dose of radiation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Ipsilateral Lung Radiation Therapy 30 Percent Prescription Dose
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the same side of the body._One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation_A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time_A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30_A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred)._A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.

As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the same side of the body.

One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::30:A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).:A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
